intro: Lachenalia massonii, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tulip-like flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its bulbs are adapted to survive dry periods, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Lachenalia massonii is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
